description: This file defines example connector classes for a software system, demonstrating registry usage and implementing base connector subclasses for PostgreSQL and Salesforce.

classes.name: PostgresConnector
classes.description: Connector class for PostgreSQL database, providing validation, probing capabilities, and example field data.

classes.name: SalesforceConnector
classes.description: Connector class for Salesforce SaaS, providing validation, probing, and example field data.

methods.name: PostgresConnector.__init__
methods.description: Initializes the PostgreSQL connector with specific type, category, and name.

methods.name: PostgresConnector.validate
methods.description: Validates the configuration dictionary for required fields 'host' and 'port'.

methods.name: PostgresConnector.probe
methods.description: Simulates probing capabilities, returning API ID and configuration fields.

methods.name: PostgresConnector.execute
methods.description: Simulates executing a job asynchronously, returning a UUID string.

methods.name: PostgresConnector.example_fields
methods.description: Provides sample configuration fields for PostgreSQL connector.

methods.name: SalesforceConnector.__init__
methods.description: Initializes the Salesforce connector with specific type, category, and name.

methods.name: SalesforceConnector.validate
methods.description: Performs placeholder validation, mainly noting no strict validation needed for OAuth.

methods.name: SalesforceConnector.probe
methods.description: Simulates probing Salesforce capabilities, including OAuth scopes and instance info.

methods.name: SalesforceConnector.execute
methods.description: Simulates executing a Salesforce sync/import job, returning a UUID string.

methods.name: SalesforceConnector.example_fields
methods.description: Provides sample configuration fields for Salesforce connector.

methods.name: str execute(self, job_type: Literal["import", "sync"], config: Dict[str, Any], params: Dict[str, Any])

ctags.name: execute
ctags.pattern: /^    async def execute(self, job_type: Literal["import", "sync"], config: Dict[str, Any], params:/
ctags.signature: (self, job_type: Literal["import", "sync"], config: Dict[str, Any], params: Dict[str, Any])

ctags.name: execute
ctags.pattern: /^    async def execute(self, job_type: Literal["import", "sync"], config: Dict[str, Any], params:/
ctags.signature: (self, job_type: Literal["import", "sync"], config: Dict[str, Any], params: Dict[str, Any])

ctags.name: probe
ctags.pattern: /^    async def probe(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:$/

ctags.name: probe
ctags.pattern: /^    async def probe(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:$/

ctags.name: validate
ctags.pattern: /^    async def validate(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:$/

ctags.pattern: /^    async def validate(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:$/
